main event: Multiple witnesses reported observing a bright light in the sky over Louisville, Kentucky, on 6 October 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as circular and the size of a dime held at arm's length., It was first observed in the west and moved southwest while descending., Miss [REDACTED] estimated the object's size to be 50-100 feet in diameter., The object was reported to be hovering at an altitude of approximately 2,000 feet before rapidly accelerating., The investigation concluded that the incident remains classified as 'unidentified.'
witness description: Mr. John Doe, a resident of Louisville, Kentucky; Miss [REDACTED], 27 years old; witness 12053.
